documents.title: TPT_Pricing Model_vFinal (Live)
documents.content:
,,

,Plan,Pricing Principles at Launch

,All,Max box price should be $250 

,Fresh/Topper/Mixed,Max freezer fill is 1/3 a small NYC apt freezer

,Fresh,Aim to price lower than TFD but only if we can make PC2 margins and economics work

,All,Charge shipping separate to box price

,All,Shipping free in first order

,All,Price per day for trial is same as for regular box before discount

,All,Price per lb does not need to decrease as calories increase within same plan although it should go in that general direction

,All,"If we ship the same amount of product, the price should be the same"

,,

,Step,Description

,1: Import costs,All costs by plan imported into pricing file

,2: Benchmark,Competitors benchmarked to build up their pricing curves

,3: Scenarios,"High level pricing scenarios chosen per plan - final scenarios chosen:
- Fresh: Match TFD prices excluding shipping fee. Fresh is headline price to fix rest to
- Mixed: Should be 5-15% below Fresh depending on size and margins
- Topper: Should be 55-62.5% of Fresh price for 50% of product depending on size and margins
- Dry: Should be lowest price and price at 38% margins"

,4: Smooth pricing,Scenarios lead to choppy pricing. This was then smoothed

,5: Check PC2 / ROIs,PC2 and ROI reviewed to increase prices and improve margins where they were low

,6: Make steps,"If giving the same qty of product for 2 or more different SKUs, the prices were matched to create some stepped pricing"

,,

,,

,Type,Elements to Change in Price Test

,Architecture issue,Ensure same amount of food in box is always the same price

,Architecture issue,Review price per Lb curves i.e. price per LB should go down as calories increase

,Architecture issue,Review PC2 margins by calories within plan; and PC2 margins across calories

,Competitor pricing,Test lowering Air Dried price to have lower entry price point to increase TAM

,Competitor pricing,Test lowering Fresh price to be more competitive with Farmers Dog & Ollie

,Competitor pricing,Test lowering Mixed price to sit in appropriate area between Fresh & Air Dried (being wary where Pantry Fresh would be)

,Architecture issue,"Lower price for larger dogs more than smaller dogs to encourage share of larger, higher ROI dogs"


============================================================
## EMAIL CONTENTS
============================================================

----------------------------------------
### EMAIL: Re: Farewell
ID: 19b278881460032f
From: Karolina Zak <kza@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Update: with the CMA Afterparty postponed to Jan, I've created a separate

session for my farewell: *Thu, 5-7pm, L3-B (sofas next to Injera)*.



You can add the event to your calendar with this link:

https://calendar.google.com/calendar/event?action=TEMPLATE&tmeid=MGl1aDU4ZGlyMnRjM2o0ZmphcmM5MGQ5bmgga3phQGhlbGxvZnJlc2guY29t&tmsrc=kza%40hellofresh.com



Hope to see many of you there!



Karo





On Mon, Dec 15, 2025 at 1:45â€¯PM Karolina Zak <kza@hellofresh.com> wrote:



> Dear all,

>

> After nearly a decade, itâ€™s time for me to say goodbye. Itâ€™s been an

> incredible and fast-paced journey, full of twists, challenges, and

> memorable moments along the way. Meeting so many great people and working

> on such interesting problems has shaped me in ways Iâ€™ll always carry with

> me, both professionally and personally.

>

> Thank you for being part of this long ride. Iâ€™m truly grateful for the

>

> Iâ€™m staying in Berlin, so hopefully our paths will cross again someday ğŸ™‚

> Karo.

### EMAIL: Low allocation of Boxes for Verden for the CO1 W-52 In MIDAS
ID: 19b273c56a9224b9
From: "'Owys Garaybeh' via HelloFresh Critical" <critical@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Hi Team,



We use MIDAS for our allocation planning, and for critical weeks like week

52. The allocation was checked yesterday and in MIDAS the CO1

allocation for W52 was 1203 and with today's run it is 790 only.



however the expected allocation is at least 2300. if the allocation in

MIDAS is somehow correct means that at least 1000 boxes will be affected.



The request is to check why MIDAS run is allocating to little boxes for VE

and if the actuals will look similar. so that we know how to mirage the

risk and plan accordingly.



--

### EMAIL: An important Update on Our Fulfillment Future
ID: 19b4512cdcc12833
From: Assaf Ronen <assaf.ronen@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

HelloFresh Team,

I wanted to take a moment to share a brief video update on Project 500, a truly foundational initiative for our long-term operational vision. The update is presented by Suman Rao, the Project 500 driver.

Please take a few minutes to watch the video, linked here<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mZdjmg8KrlPhyL7zpIFrPtMAriq9Do_f/view?usp=sharing>.

Project 500 has been a massive cross-functional undertaking, and I want to express my sincere appreciation for the incredible collaboration and countless hours many of you have dedicated to reaching this stage. Your efforts are building the core of our future fulfillment capabilities.

With the Week 6 launch at our Arizona Distribution Center fast approaching, our end-to-end testing indicates that we are nearly ready. The deep technical and operational learnings we gain from Project 500 here in the U.S. are critical. They will not only redefine our domestic fulfillment model but also provide a proven blueprint for scaling and implementing these advanced systems across our international markets over time.

Thank you again for your relentless focus and commitment to this game-changing initiative.

Best regards,

Assaf

### EMAIL: We let ChatGPT buy our xmas presents
ID: 19b41a91c96a7a24
From: Mindstream <hello@mindstream.news>
----------------------------------------

----------

The tangerine-in-the-stocking thing started with 12th-century French nuns.



They used to leave socks filled with tangerines, nuts, and fruit on the doorsteps of local families , a small act of kindness that snowballed into a Christmas tradition.



Centuries later, weâ€™re still unwrapping citrus like itâ€™s festive gold.



**Whatâ€™s in store:**



* **We gave ChatGPT $200 and set it lose on Christmas shopping**



* **AI Predictions 2026: **Mariaâ€™s hot takes



_Read Time: 4 minutes_





--------------------

###### **XMAS WITH AI**



## I Gave ChatGPT $200 to Buy All My Holiday Gifts â€” Hereâ€™s What Happened



View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/ad3ea898-6c11-4a0e-896f-76103c7799bb/Matt_Village_Create_a_digital_illustration_in_a_clean_modern__0c6f8dfe-6e0c-4269-8f75-03e71bcac340_3.png?t=1765812607)

Follow image link: (https://www.mindstream.news/)

Caption: 



The holidays are supposed to be a joyful time, until you remember you need to buy 14 gifts, ship half of them internationally, and still look like you â€˜put thought into it.â€™



This year, I decided to let ChatGPT take over my holiday shopping.



### **Ask ChatGPT to help you shop**



I started simple:



_â€œYouâ€™re my personal shopper with impeccable taste. I have $200 and need 5 gifts â€” one for my sister (into skincare), one for my dad (tech gadgets), one for my partner (foodie), one for a coworker (funny but class



ad will be the ones that feel opinionated, uneven, and unmistakably authored. This will quietly change how writers work. Drafting will speed up. Editing will slow down. More time will be spent deciding what stays strange, what remains unresolved, and what should not be improved. _



_In 2026, the signal of quality will not be clean prose or tight structure. It will be friction. A sentence that lingers. A chapter that refuses to explain itself. A book that trusts the reader to keep up. AI will raise the floor for books. Human judgment will decide which ones matter._





----------**Riddle Me This Answer: **_24 carrots, 4 glasses of sherry._** **

If youâ€™re not off work yet, well, that sucks.
